quotes: A bit more than a week before the vote was to take place (November 20, 1990), Baker (who was in Paris) called Qian with a “deal.”
Thinking he had Qian’s agreement, Baker was angered when China abstained from the Security Council vote on November 28, 1990, and he tried to withdraw the invitation to Qian to visit the White House.
Whether those feelings played a role in how Baker was treated on his visit to Beijing the following November, Qian does not say.

roles.title: Chinese ambassador
quotes: Early -morning phone calls from the Chinese ambassador to Brent Scowcroft put the Oval Office meeting back on the schedule,
Qian does conclude the anecdote by noting that he and Scowcroft shared a hearty laugh about the toast during one of Qian’s later visits to Washington.
Baker (who was in Paris) called Qian with a “deal.”
Whether those feelings played a role in how Baker was treated on his visit to Beijing the following November, Qian does not say.

If China would support the U.S. resolution on Iraq —or at least pledge not to veto it —Baker would be happy to invite Qian to make an official visit to Washington, with a visit to the Oval Office as part of the bargain.
That would break the ban on high -level meetings that had been in effect since Tiananmen.
that China might also fall victim to the same public pressures that had brought down most of the socialist governments of Eastern Europe.
